content:
Hi, Thunderbird doesn't offer message translations by default.

Please check and see whether your email provider does that or if you enabled an addon in Thunderbird such as https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-us/thunderbird/addon/deepl-selected-text/

If you are not sure how to do that, please check here https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/thunderbird-add-ons-frequently-asked-questions
creator: shopov.bogomil

content: Ik vond nog dit artikel, maar weet niet of dat soelaas zal bieden. Misschien is een volledig nieuwe installatie van Thunderbird een oplossing; de gegevens zullen niet weg zijn, maar wellicht wel tijdelijk niet direct vindbaar, als er een ander profiel wordt aangemaakt. Maar stap voor stap: eerst de vraag om herstart zien weg te krijgen. Download via https://www.thunderbird.net/nl/ de laatste versie en installeer deze. Als dit lukt en de herstartvraag is verdwenen, maar er zijn nog geen contacten zichtbaar, dan is de volgende stap het juiste profiel zien te vinden.
creator: markh2

content:
an error message comes up that says the mail server responded with error code 43TH9mcn085202 and blocked the email

As you stated, the error comes from your email provider's server, not Thunderbird. You'll have to talk to your email provider about why they think your message is spam.

As a workaround you may want to try sending the message via webmail.
creator: christ1

content:
Unfortunately, it seems that a Thunderbird update has caused the problem of losing your email accounts and calendars. But don't worry, you can restore the old profile file to restore your accounts and calendars.

Here are the steps that can be followed:

Close Thunderbird completely. Find the files folder of your old Thunderbird profile. It is usually stored in a location like: C:\Users\YourUserName\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\. Find a folder containing files and folders that look like this pattern: random.default. "random" will be a random string of letters and numbers. Copy this entire folder and paste it somewhere convenient on your computer for later use. Now, open the new Thunderbird. Go to Help > Technical Information in the menu bar. In the About App section, click Folders at the bottom of the page. Click "Open Folder" next to "Folder for Files." You will be taken to your new Thunderbird profile folder. Close Thunderbird. Open the opened folder and click on the "Profiles" folder. Move the old folder you copied in step 4 to this folder. Open Thunderbird again, and once it's open, your email accounts and calendars should appear as they were. Please note that this may require some time as Thunderbird may reload and rebuild some data.
creator: ahmedhabes140

content:
Hello, Currently the sort function allows you to use only one condition. If you pick by "sender" they are ordered by this field.

If you want to get all the messages from one sender by date, you could: - Order by Date - Use the quick filter to add the recipient's name and filter out with more granularity.

I hope that helps!
creator: shopov.bogomil
